name: Private Guided Tour of the Automotive Wonders of the World!
description: For a limited group of individuals, we will open out a treasure trove hidden in Bangalore! You will get to experience the restoration, preservation & collection of Historic Cars, Motorcycles, Carriages and all things automotive passionately built over the past 40 years!

location.address: Rajarajeshwari Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: Classic Chase
organizer.description: Immerse yourself in an era gone by...

name: Magic: The Gathering with ReRoll Board Games
description: After many years of talking about this, we’re finally starting a Magic: The Gathering meetup. If you are curious about this massively popular card game, or are already a player looking to find others to play with in-person, this is for you!For people who’ve never played before:This is designed for new players to explore the game. We’ll teach you the rules, and will pair up new players with each other. We’ll be playing the with 40-card decks, using the Jumpstart 2022 set - which is a great way to learn the game without too much time on deck building.For experienced playersWe have a few premade standard (60 card) decks to play, as well a few commander decks.This is a light, friendly environment for players to explore the game and meet the community - it is not a competitive event. Be helpful, and expect people to make mistakes.

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Clueless Crossword by Quiz Pro Quo
description: Are you ready to tackle the ultimate brain-teasing challenge? Gather your team and step into the world of Clueless Crossword, where solving the puzzle means asking the right questions!Here’s the twist:• We’ve created a crossword with 20 answers, but there are no direct clues.• Each clue is the last name of a popular person. Think you can figure out who they are?• Teams take turns asking yes/no questions to narrow down the possibilities.• Example: “Is 2 down a musician?” or “Is 5 across a historical figure?”• Keep going until someone cracks the grid and takes the crown!Whether you’re a trivia master, a crossword enthusiast, or just love a fun challenge, this is your chance to shine. Come solo or bring a team, your wits, and your best questions!About Quiz Pro Quo?QPQ is a community to introduce people to quizzing. They come together every week to crack questions on everyday topics. They have been hosting quizzes online and in person since May 2020. You can follow QPQ on their Instagram @quiz.pro.quo

name: A Window into Kalaripayatt with Robin Philip
description: Step Into the World of Kalaripayatt with Urban KalariExperience the ancient wisdom of Kalaripayattu through a modern lens in this beginner-friendly workshop, A Window into Kalaripayatt. Guided by Robin Philip—an expert with over a decade of training under esteemed Gurukkals—this program breaks down the essence of this martial art into a relatable, accessible format.Workshop Highlights:Foundational Movements: Master basic stances, leg raises, jumps, and sequences.Precision and Form: Avoid common errors and engage correctly for maximum impact.Flow and Connection: Practice two full-body flows for a seamless integration of movement.Kalari Philosophy: Discover the principles of Kalaripayattu and Kalari Chikilsa to understand how to foster a deeper mind-body connection.Who Should Join?This workshop is perfect for anyone curious about Kalari, seeking a holistic workout or exploring animal-inspired movement. Whether you’re reconnecting with movement or starting fresh, this is your gateway to the profound art of Kalaripayattu.Rediscover the balance of strength, agility, mobility, and mindfulness. Join us and take the first step into this transformative journey at our lovely Studio, we'll also be serving up some delicious healthy snacks.

name: Korean Shop with Chef Gokul
description: We’re ringing in the new year with a Korean Shop by Chef Gokul!This new year, we invite you to explore the rich, vibrant flavors of Korean cuisine at The Conservatory with Korean Shop by Chef Gokul. This special menu is a tribute to the late-night culinary adventures Chef Gokul experienced in New York’s Koreatown, but with a personal twist—he was first introduced to Korean cooking by his Korean friend’s mother and grandmother, whose home-cooked meals left a mark on his culinary journey.Chef Gokul, a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, has perfected his craft at renowned Michelin-starred restaurants such as Junoon, Aureole, The Clock Tower, Rezdora, and Dominique in New York, as well as Blackbird in Chicago. His expertise spans both culinary and pastry arts, and his innovative creations have taken Chennai by storm through his brand Hygge By Chef Gokul.From Italian to Korean, Japanese to Thai, Filipino to Ethiopian, Chef Gokul’s culinary expertise covers a world of flavors. His time in New York, shaped by the warmth of Korean home cooking, inspired him to bring the bold, comforting tastes of Korea to life in this pop-up.Korean Shop Menu - à la carteBanchan (Side Dishes)Tongbaechu Kimchi (Napa Cabbage Kimchi)Pa Kimchi (Spring Onion and Apple Kimchi)Oi Muchim (Cucumber Kimchi)Kakdugi (Korean Radish Kimchi)Gaji Namul (Eggplant Side Dish)Sigeumchi Namul (Soy Garlic Spinach)Small PlatesCheese Tteokbokki (V) 560Chewy Korean Rice Cakes, Spicy Jang Sauce, Melted Cheese, Scallions, Sesame SeedsPyeonsu (Cold Dumplings) (V) 420North Korean Specialty Dumplings, Noodles, Chef’s Special Garu Chili Crisp, Soy, ScallionsYangneyeom Dak 560Sweet and Spicy Korean Fried ChickenBuldak 630Fiery Spicy Korean Fried ChickenLarge PlatesDak Kalguksu 980Knife-Cut Noodles, Marinated Chicken, Rich Chicken Broth, Soy Tare, Perilla Roasted Seaweed, Marinated Egg, Roasted Sesame Powder, ScallionsDolcet Bibimbap 1050Sizzling Stone Bowl with Crusted Crispy Rice, Bulgogi Beef/Buldak Chicken, Sautéed Vegetables and Seasoned Greens, Bellflower Root, Napa Kimchi, Sunny Side Egg, Chef’s Special Bibimbap SauceSanchae Bibimbap (V) 980Sizzling Stone Bowl with Crusted Crispy Rice, Sanchae (Seasonal Wild Vegetables), Sautéed Vegetables and Seasoned Greens, Bellflower Root, Napa Kimchi, Sunny Side Egg, Chef’s Special Bibimbap SauceBokkeum-bap (Junggukjip Bokkeum-Bap) (Contains Egg) 630Fried Rice Made with Scallion Infused Oil, Jajang Sauce, Eggs, Chef’s Special Garu Chili CrispBossam (with Jeyuk Bokkeum) 980Spicy Marinated Pork Belly, Steamed Rice, Lettuce, Ssamjang, Onion, Garlic, KimchiTofu Ssam (V) 910Spicy Tofu Bulgogi, Steamed Rice, Lettuce, Ssamjang, Onion, Garlic, KimchiTerms and Conditions: Please note, INR 1200 from the ticket price is redeemable against the food menuThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.The conservatory is located on the 2nd floor of the Courtyard which is a 44 step climb upPlease arrive on time for your selected slot, as your ticket is valid only for that specific time. Once purchased, your slot cannot be changed.Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Children over 7 years of age require a ticket.Children below the age of 7 are not allowed.No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

name: A 2 Day Kalaripayattu Workshop
description: We are hosting a 2-day Live Kalaripayattu workshop on 11th & 12 Jan 2025 (Saturday & Sunday)We are bringing to you Specially curated exercises inspired from Kalaripayattu that can be practised at the comfort of your home.What's included in the Workshop:A 2 Day Live workshop provided by Experienced Kalaripayattu Teachers on 11th & 12 Jan 2025 each.There would be 1.5 hours of a Online session 1 week prior to the workshop to brief you about the workshop and to provide Theoretical Introduction to the Kalaripayattu movements and to address other question and answers.Post workshop , there would be 1.5 hours of Online Session 1 week later to clear your doubts and address other issues related.Support through whatsapp / Call in future.This workshop is open for both Adults and Kids. There movements would be different and according to the respective age groupsBenefits of attending this Workshop:Learn Scientific , Natural Kalaripayattu Movements as a fitness routine to include in your day to day Lifestyle (no equipments required)Improve Mental Focus & MindfulnessDevelop A Stronger, Healthier Spine

name: A JIVAMUKTI Yoga Backbends Workshop led by Ninya
description: “The Gateway to Backbends: Exploring the Psoas”A JIVAMUKTI Yoga Workshop led by Ninya LehrheuerThe psoas, often referred to as the “muscle of the soul,” plays a key role in connecting the spine, pelvis, and legs—bridging not just movement, but also memory and emotional experience stored in the body. This workshop explores how releasing tension in the psoas can free us from long-held patterns, both physical and mental, that stem from the past.Aligned with the Jivamukti Focus of the Month, “What’s Inside Memory,” we’ll reflect on how the body holds echoes of past experiences and explore how mindful psoas stretching and backbending can help dissolve those imprints. Through a combination of anatomical insight, guided movement, and breath work, you’ll learn how to stabilize and expand into heart-opening backbends that cultivate liberation and presence.Join us for this journey to discover what lies within the psoas—and how unlocking it can open the heart and release the memories that keep us tethered to the past.

name: Courtyard Kids Playdate with The LooRoo Club
description: Courtyard's monthly playdate with The LooRoo Club is back!Celebrate the joy of India’s harvest festivals with a magical playdate your kids will love! January marks the season of vibrant traditions like Makar Sankranti, Pongal, Lohri, and Bihu, and we’re bringing them to life in a fun, hands-on way.Here’s what’s in store:Paint Pongal potsDecorate colorful kitesDance to lively folk songsCreate stunning rangoli designsEnjoy festive treatsFor children aged 3 to 8 years, accompanied by a parent.Give your little ones a chance to explore art, food, and culture while celebrating India’s beautiful traditions. Book your tickets now and let’s make some memories!P.S. Perfect for young kids—fun, engaging, and unforgettableTerms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. name: Yin Yoga + Sound Bath
description: Come join us this Full Moon, for a yin yoga + sound bath experience.Deepika an experienced sound bath practitioner aims in blending creative expression and sound healing to manifest desires. Followed by a guided meditation and enhanced by the soothing tones of singing bowls. This deep relaxation and focus help you feel your dreams coming to life, fostering a powerful sense of connection to your goals. This session will also have a yin yoga practice, led by Julia, integrated into the sound healing session.What to bring:Yoga matSmall pillowBlindfold/ eye mask/ scarfWater bottle

name: Strength & Flow: a Yoga Brunch with Shruti
description: Begin 2025 with intention—build strength and flow with Shruti in this invigorating class.Designed for all levels, Shruti’s class challenges both physical and mental resilience. Expect a dynamic flow that encourages you to sit with discomfort, move through it, and emerge stronger—mentally and physically. As Shruti says, “It won’t be easy,” but the growth will be worth it.After class, join us for a nourishing power brunch featuring plant-based, high-protein dishes, fibre-rich salads, nutrient-dense smoothies, and wellness shots—a celebration of what our bodies can achieve.Let’s start the year together with movement, nourishment, and community. 🌱

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, a new event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves. Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table**Tickets are for entry and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.
